intro: Gymnosporia ellenbeckii, commonly known as the Ellenbeck's burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, spherical, spiny fruits. Gymnosporia ellenbeckii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
